body:
On the `next` branch the code has changed to this:

https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/14d6472444e7b67a433be8265c1d1198bff035ec/lib/FunctionModuleTemplatePlugin.js#L81-L85
@sokra Is it possible to port this fix for version 3.x?

issue.title: fixes #8949

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**
Bugfix #8949 

**Did you add tests for your changes?**
No (Should we add performances tests for this kind of situation?)

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?**
No

**What needs to be documented once your changes are merged?**
Nothing

issue.title: Backport performance fix for template plugin

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

body: I didn't catch the 3.x an not the 4.x, my bad. Can we still merge some patches in `webpack-3` branch?
Oh sorry. I didn't see that you want to backport to v3. No, webpack 3 is outdated and won't get such fixes. A backport to v4 (master) is fine.
If you have a problem with performance, your should start by upgrading to webpack 4, which has a lot of performance improvements.
